e802cb06-73a2-45ec-bc77-9b1b09cecd07.benefit: pvrclawk is a modular agent tool where feature groups are pluggable command categories. Root registers groups, each group owns its internals.
criteria: app.py only imports and registers Click groups
Feature packages are self-contained under src/pvrclawk/<name>/
Adding a new feature group requires no changes to existing groups

6b1c7b7b-5e80-47bb-8539-f3439b51f6a0.benefit: V1 feature group providing 8 node types, cluster storage, weighted links, mood tracking, DSL rules, and frequency-relative scoring.
criteria: All 8 node types (memory, memorylink, story, feature, active, archive, pattern, progress) can be created and retrieved
Nodes stored in named cluster files under .pvrclawk/nodes/
Links between nodes carry tags, weight, decay, and usage_count
Focus command retrieves context-relevant nodes using scored links
Mood tracking and DSL rules modulate scoring
Prune command rebalances clusters via Louvain community detection

0b71bfb3-f04d-4b80-bfc4-4e8e964c5656.benefit: Every feature slice follows red-green-refactor. Unit tests for core logic, integration tests for CLI, e2e for full pipeline. No code before failing test.
criteria: Every new feature starts with a failing test
Implementation is minimal code to pass the test
Refactoring only happens after green
Unit tests cover models and core logic, integration tests cover CLI commands

44352481-241e-4298-81ba-be58b90eceab.benefit: All membank internals (commands, core, models) live under src/pvrclawk/membank/. Root package is thin: app.py registers groups only. No membank logic at root level.
criteria: membank/ contains its own commands/, core/, and models/ subdirectories
No membank-specific imports in src/pvrclawk/app.py beyond registering the group
Universal utilities live in src/pvrclawk/utils/, not in membank

75c0b3a9-413f-4d25-a9ae-7da5b7a78976.benefit: Decay is governed by usage_count/total_frequency, not wall-clock time. Scoring formula: tag_match * weight * decay * freq_decay * mood * rules.
criteria: Link.usage_count tracks how often a link is traversed
Decay factor is link_usage_count / total_frequency, not datetime-based
Score formula: tag_match * weight * decay * freq_decay * mood_factor * rule_adjustment
Zero-score results are filtered out before ranking

afc53f28-7d2b-4f69-b46e-4b4dbd7c6251.content: Red-green-refactor for every slice. Unit tests for core, integration for CLI, e2e for pipeline. No implementation before failing test.

ebe395ff-43dd-4b37-bc77-bd5ad236b35d.content: Decay is frequency-relative: usage_count/total_frequency. Not wall-clock. Score = tag_match * weight * freq_decay * mood * rules.
